meanings.definition: To select or take out a passage or segment from a larger work.
meanings.sent1: She excerpted the most exciting part of the story for her presentation.
meanings.sent2: The teacher excerpted a paragraph from the textbook to discuss in class.
meanings.sent3: The detective excerpted a crucial clue from the witness's statement.
meanings.sent4: He excerpted wisdom from the ancient texts to guide his decisions.
meanings.sent5: The chef excerpted the secret ingredient to make the dish perfect.

meanings.definition: A passage or segment that has been selected or taken out from a larger work.
meanings.sent1: The anthology included an excerpted poem from a famous poet.
meanings.sent2: She found an interesting excerpted passage in the history book.
meanings.sent3: The children enjoyed reading the excerpted story from the fairy tale book.
meanings.sent4: The exhibit displayed an excerpted painting from the artist's collection.
meanings.sent5: The magazine published an excerpted interview with the celebrity.
